property.name: text
property.value: This model contains 5 nodes. Each node is running a version of Surge, with a unique nodeID that corresponds to the number in their given name. Surge is an example application developed for TinyOS that uses MultiHop ad-hoc routing. Each Surge node takes light readings and forwards them to a base station. The routing protocol uses a windowed average success rate to perform link estimation, and uses it to choose its parent, to whom the node forwards all packets. The base station (node 0) periodically sends out a beacon message so that nodes can update their position in the network if necessary.

property.name: text
property.value: Authors: Heather Taylor and Elaine Cheong

property.name: text
property.value: To automatically rearrange the component layout, select Graph | Automatic Layout from the menu, or type Ctrl-T.
